com.cs301w01.meatload.model

Class SQLiteDBManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLiteOpenHelper
      • com.cs301w01.meatload.model.SQLiteDBManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DBManager

    public class SQLiteDBManager
extends SQLiteOpenHelper
implements DBManager
    This class is helper for dealing with SQLite in Android. It provides a variety of useful methods for creating, updating, deleting, and selecting data.
    See Also:
    http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/119293/Using-SQLite-Database-with-Android

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SQLiteDBManager(Context context)
      Constructor, creates an SQLiteDBManager with the given Context.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long insert(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String colId, ContentValues cv)
      This method is used to insert new tuples into a database.
      void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase newDB)
      This method will be called the first time a Database is instantiated by this app on this particular phone.
      void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase sqLiteDatabase, int i, int i1)
      When the version of database is increase this method will be called by Android, reseting the database with any new changes made to the tables.
      Cursor performRawQuery(java.lang.String query)
      Performs a raw SQL Select query.
      void resetDB()
      Used to force changes to update in the sql table during testing

      This method is used to update tuples in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase newDB)
        This method will be called the first time a Database is instantiated by this app on this particular phone. Once created, unless reset or uninstalled, this method will not run again. Android calls this method automatically.
        Parameters:
        newDB -

      • resetDB

        public void resetDB()
        Used to force changes to update in the sql table during testing

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase sqLiteDatabase,
             int i,
             int i1)
        When the version of database is increase this method will be called by Android, reseting the database with any new changes made to the tables.
        Parameters:
        sqLiteDatabase - The DB to update
        i - the old version
        i1 - the new version

      • performRawQuery

        public Cursor performRawQuery(java.lang.String query)
        Performs a raw SQL Select query. Returns a cursor set to the first result.
        Specified by:
        performRawQuery in interface DBManager
        Parameters:
        query - Query to be sent to database
        Returns:
        Cursor to first result of query, or null if query is empty

      • update

        public int update(java.lang.String tableName,
         ContentValues cv,
         java.lang.String whereClause,
         java.lang.String[] whereArgs)
        This method is used to update tuples in the database.
        Specified by:
        update in interface DBManager
        Parameters:
        tableName - name of the table you are updating a table for
        cv - ContentValue object which contains the changed values
        whereClause - the tuple column comparison for determining which rows to update
        whereArgs[] - args for the where clause

      • insert

        public long insert(java.lang.String tableName,
          java.lang.String colId,
          ContentValues cv)
        This method is used to insert new tuples into a database.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface DBManager
        Parameters:
        tableName - String name of the table inserting on
        colId - String representation of the primary key column id as represented in the create table statement, example: "id_"
        cv - ContentValues a content values object hash which contains a key for the column name, and a value to insert for that column
        Returns:
        id long value of the row id that was created by the insert
